on 15/03/2013, at 8:15 pm, "rperezb" <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> @jdimeglio reported this on the ios repository
> 
> help help help
> 
> my problem is that when i use my external share i get the error
> 
> "the files you are trying to upload exceed the maximum size for file uploads on this server. "
> 
> however its not from php.ini limits. :-) already check that.
> 
> so i'm using a mount.php which mounts to an external smb share. the smb share is on a windows 2008 server and im using the domain admin account to authenticate. it works. i can see files and via the own cloud web interface i can see files, create folders and create text files all through owncloud.
> 
> however...
> 
> when i try to upload i get the error message above. i noticed whenever i hover over the green up arrow it says upload max 0b. as soon as i remove the mount.php it changes to 500mb - and therefore i can upload.
> so im thinking its getting "quota'" from somewhere or its a permission issue somewhere??
> 
> im using ldap authentication. but this also happens to the owncloud account.
> my environment
> 
> i have installed the latest owncloud 4.5.7 onto a open suse server. fresh install. running sqllite, appache etc
> mount.php - this is a copy of my mount.php.
> 
> <?php return array (
> 'user' => array (
> 'all' => array (
> '/$user/files' => array ( 'class' => 'oc_filestorage_smb', 'options' => array ( 'host' => 'server', 'user' => 'adminaccount', 'password' => 'adminapassword', 'share' => '/share/$user/files', 0 => '/$user/files', ),),
> ),
> ),
> );
> 
> this https://forum.owncloud.org/viewtopic.php?t=7733&p=20794 sounds similar to my issue - i made the changes and it didnt help.
> 
> help help. my owncloud server doesnt have the space and there must use a samba share.
> 
> thanks
> 
> joe
